channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI is the common threat—and the secret sauce—for security startups in the Fortune Cyber 60
item.description: The latest installment of the Fortune Cyber 60 list, created in partnership with Lightspeed Venture Partners, reveals how critical AI security has bec...

item.title: Longevity science is on the cusp of major breakthroughs thanks to AI, but significant ‘data gaps’ need to be filled, expert says
item.description: There’s a dearth of data about how differences in gender, ethnicities, and environments can affect the aging process.

item.title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella says Bill Gates told him his big bet on OpenAI would be a flop: ‘Yeah, you’re going to burn this billion dollars’
item.description: Nadella said despite the risk, “it was not that hard to convince anyone.”

item.title: China just purchased its first U.S. soybeans from this year’s harvest before Trump and Xi meet at economic summit
item.description: The progress marks quicker negotiations between the two countries after China’s crackdown on rare-earths exports, expert says.

item.title: Delta CEO Ed Bastian says one key to building customer loyalty is ‘obsessing’ over your own staff
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Will the Fed cut interest rates in December? Here’s what experts are saying.
Alphabet says Google's Gemini is catching up to ChatGPT's popularity — live
Nvidia just became the first $5 trillion company. Here’s how big that really is.
Meta's stock sinks as earnings miss expectations due to a tax charge — live
